alert.note: Alert for Avery; Caldwell Mountains (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CALDWELL AND SOUTHEASTERN AVERY COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM EDT... At 910 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Blowing Rock, or 7 miles south of Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Grandfather Mountain State Park, Edgemont, Globe, Upton, Patterson, and the Blue Ridge Parkway between Linville Falls and Grandfather. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
